title: 113_s1268
content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: Agreement refers to the document signed by the United States and Palau on September 3, 2010. Compact of Free Association refers to the agreement between the US and Palau. Results of Compact Review: Title I of Public Law 99-658 is amended to include a section on the results of the compact review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, funds may be withheld. In fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, funds payable under the Compact of Free Association to Palau will be withheld until Palau reimburses the trust fund for amounts exceeding $5,000,000 withdrawn. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific sections of the Agreement. Authorization for appropriations is provided. In fiscal years 2014 through 2024, $1,500,000 is authorized annually to subsidize postal services for Palau, the Marshall Islands, and Micronesia. Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association are also authorized necessary funds for their responsibilities. Repeal of Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 and amendment to Compact section 211(f) fund regarding payment schedule and funding. "Repeal of Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 and amendment to Compact section 211(f) fund for payment schedule and funding." The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a specific schedule. Additionally, a grant will be provided annually to create an Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Government of Palau will match contributions made by the United States to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund with $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The Fiscal Consolidation Fund will be implemented according to the provisions of the Agreement. The Fiscal Consolidation Fund will be implemented as per the Agreement. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, Palau will receive $69,250,000 in economic assistance, with $12,000,000 allocated for fiscal year 2014. The agreement outlines a decreasing scale of financial assistance from $12,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to $2,000,000 in fiscal year 2023. Funds will be provided in quarterly payments for economic assistance. Additionally, infrastructure projects will be addressed in the agreement. The United States will provide $40,000,000 in grants to Palau for infrastructure projects, with $30,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 and $5,000,000 annually in fiscal years 2015 and 2016. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 is amended to extend programs until 2024. Passport requirements are also addressed in the agreement. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories can be admitted without certain passport requirements if they are citizens of Palau or acquire Palauan citizenship at birth. Citizens of Palau, whether by birth or naturalization, who have resided in Palau for at least five years after naturalization, are permitted to work in the United States. They may establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. This right is not extended to Palauan citizens under Section 141(a). Section 141(a) does not grant Palauan citizens the right to establish residence for naturalization or petition for benefits under the Immigration and Nationality Act in the United States. However, it does not prevent them from acquiring these rights or obtaining lawful permanent resident status.
